question:
Which national park in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands is home to species like Megapode, crab-eating Macaque, Nicobar Pigeon, and Giant Robber Crab?

[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
option_2: Campbell Bay National Park
solution:
Correct Answer: Campbell Bay National Park

Explanation:

  • Campbell Bay National Park, located in the Great Nicobar Island of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, is home to unique and rare species such as:
  • Nicobar Megapode (a rare bird known for its mound-nesting behavior)
  • Crab-eating Macaque (a species of monkey found in coastal regions)
  • Nicobar Pigeon (a beautifully colored pigeon endemic to the Nicobar Islands)
  • Giant Robber Crab (also known as the coconut crab, the world's largest land-dwelling arthropod)
  • It is part of the Great Nicobar Biosphere Reserve and is known for its rich biodiversity and tropical rainforest ecosystem.
  • Other Options:
  • Papikonda National Park: located in Andhra Pradesh, known for its Eastern Ghats ecosystem.
  • Raimona National Park: located in Assam, famous for golden langurs.
  • Mouling National Park: located in Arunachal Pradesh, known for red pandas and takins

question:
In which state of India is the Tadoba National Park located?

[SSC CGL 2024 T-1]
solution:
Correct Answer: Maharashtra

Explanation:

  • Tadoba National Park, also known as Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve, is located in the Chandrapur district of Maharashtra. It is one of India's oldest and largest national parks and is famous for its rich biodiversity, particularly its tiger population.
  • Other options:
  • Madhya Pradesh: Has famous national parks like Kanha, Bandhavgarh, and Pench but not Tadoba.
  • Kerala: Known for Periyar and Silent Valley National Parks.
  • Gujarat: Home to Gir National Park, famous for Asiatic lions.

question:
The Keoladeo National Park is located in the state of _______.

[SSC SP-12 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is Rajasthan.

Explanation: -

  • Keoladeo National Park is a famous bird sanctuary located in the state of Rajasthan, India. It is situated near the town of Bharatpur and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The park is known for its rich biodiversity, particularly its large population of migratory birds, and is a popular destination for birdwatching.
  • Brief Explanation of the Other Options:
  • Odisha: While Odisha is home to other important wildlife sanctuaries and national parks, Keoladeo National Park is not located there.
  • Gujarat: Gujarat has notable parks such as Gir National Park (home to Asiatic lions) and Rann of Kutch, but Keoladeo is in Rajasthan.
  • Madhya Pradesh: Madhya Pradesh is home to several famous national parks like Kanha National Park and Bandhavgarh National Park, but Keoladeo is located in Rajasthan.

question: According to June 2025, How many National Parks are there in India?
solution:
The Correct Answer is: C) 107
  • According to June 2025, Total National Parks in India: 107
  • Simlipal National Park in Odisha is notified as the 107th National Parks in India in April 2025.
    • 2nd National Park of Odisha after Bhitarkanika.
    • Also the Largest national park in Odisha.
    • The park is home to Bengal tiger, Asian elephant, gaur, and chausingha.
  • Covers approx. 35% of geographical area
  • First National Park: Jim Corbett (1936, Uttarakhand)
  • Declared under Wildlife Protection Act, 1972

A National Park is a protected area set up mainly to protect the wildlife and their habitat, where activities like hunting, grazing, forestry, and cultivation are strictly prohibited. It provides the highest level of protection to biodiversity.

question: Which state has the maximum number of National Parks in India?
solution:
The Correct Answer is: C) Madhya Pradesh
  • Maximum National Parks: Madhya Pradesh (11)
  • Important National Parks: Kanha, Bandhavgarh, Satpura, Pench, Panna
  • Known as “Tiger State of India”, due to its high tiger population (526 tigers) and the presence of numerous tiger reserves.

question: Which Union Territory has the maximum number of Wildlife Sanctuaries in India?
option_4: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
solution:
The Correct Answer is: D) Andaman and Nicobar Islands
  • Maximum Wildlife Sanctuaries: Andaman and Nicobar Islands (97)
  • Total Wildlife Sanctuaries in India: 573
  • Covers approx. 67% of geographical area
  • Declared under Wildlife Protection Act, 1972

A Wildlife Sanctuary is a protected area where animals are protected from any external threat like hunting, but some limited human activities (like grazing or firewood collection) may be allowed without harming wildlife.

question: Gir Forests is famous for which of the following wildlife species?
solution:
• Gir Forests are located in Gujarat.
  • Famous as the only natural habitat of Asiatic Lions in the world.
  • Declared as Wildlife Sanctuary in 1965 and National Park in 1975.
  • Other important National Parks of Gujarat: Blackbuck National Park (Velavadar), Marine National Park (Gulf of Kutch).

question: Kaziranga Sanctuary, famous for One Horned Rhino, is located in which state?
solution:
• Kaziranga National Park is located in Assam.
  • Famous for largest population of One Horned Rhinoceros in the world.
  • Declared as National Park in 1974, UNESCO World Heritage Site.
  • Other important National Parks of Assam: Manas National Park, Nameri National Park, Dibru-Saikhowa National Park, Orang National Park.

question: Which sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh was once the second home of Asiatic Lion?
solution:
• Chandraprabha Sanctuary is in Uttar Pradesh, near Varanasi.
  • Declared as second home of Asiatic Lion in 1957, but project failed.
  • Famous for leopards, deer, and waterfalls (Rajdari & Devdari).
  • Other important Wildlife Sanctuaries in Uttar Pradesh: Sohagi Barwa, Kaimoor, Hastinapur, Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuaries.

question: Keoladeo Bird Sanctuary, also known as Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, is located in which state?
solution:
• Keoladeo Ghana National Park is located in Rajasthan.
  • Also known as Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, famous for migratory birds like Siberian Crane.
  • Declared as Sanctuary in 1956 and National Park in 1982.
  • Other important National Parks in Rajasthan: Ranthambore, Sariska, Desert National Park, Mukundra Hills.

question: Dachigam Sanctuary is famous for which endangered species?
option_3: Hangul or Kashmiri Stag
solution:
• Dachigam Sanctuary is located in Jammu & Kashmir near Srinagar.
  • Famous for Hangul or Kashmiri Stag, which is critically endangered.
  • Declared as National Park in 1981.
  • Other important National Parks in J&K: Hemis National Park, Kishtwar National Park, Salim Ali National Park.

question: Bandhavgarh National Park, famous for Royal Bengal Tiger, is located in which state?
solution:
• Bandhavgarh National Park is located in Madhya Pradesh.
  • Famous for highest density of Royal Bengal Tigers in India.
  • Declared as National Park in 1968 and Tiger Reserve in 1993.
  • Other important National Parks in Madhya Pradesh: Kanha, Pench, Satpura, Panna.

question: Jim Corbett National Park, the first National Park of India, is located in which state?
solution:
• Jim Corbett National Park is located in Uttarakhand.
  • First National Park of India, established in 1936 as Hailey National Park.
  • Famous for Royal Bengal Tigers and Project Tiger launched here in 1973.
  • Other important National Parks in Uttarakhand: Rajaji National Park, Nanda Devi National Park, Valley of Flowers National Park.

question: Kanha National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Kanha National Park is located in Madhya Pradesh.
  • Known for Barasingha (Swamp Deer) conservation and tigers.
  • Declared as National Park in 1955, Tiger Reserve in 1973.
  • Other important National Parks in Madhya Pradesh: Bandhavgarh, Pench, Satpura, Panna.

question: Shivpuri National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Shivpuri National Park is located in Madhya Pradesh.
  • It is part of Madhav National Park, located in Shivpuri district.
  • Famous for chinkara, chital, nilgai, and leopards.
  • Other important National Parks in Madhya Pradesh: Kanha, Bandhavgarh, Pench, Satpura, Panna.

question: Hazaribagh National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Hazaribagh National Park is located in Jharkhand.
  • Famous for sloth bear, chital, nilgai, sambar, and leopards.
  • Other important National Parks/Wildlife Sanctuaries of Jharkhand: Betla National Park, Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Ranchi
    • Festival: Karam, Sohrai
    • Important River: Damodar
    • Formed in 2000 from Bihar

question: Periyar National Park, famous for elephants, is located in which state?
solution:
• Periyar National Park is located in Kerala.
  • Famous for elephants, tigers, and Periyar Lake boat safari.
  • It is a tiger reserve and elephant reserve.
  • Other important National Parks of Kerala: Eravikulam, Silent Valley, Anamudi Shola, Mathikettan Shola.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Thiruvananthapuram
    • Dance: Kathakali, Mohiniyattam
    • Highest peak: Anamudi
    • Kerala is called “Spice Garden of India”

question: Dudhwa National Park, located on Indo-Nepal border, is in which state?
solution:
• Dudhwa National Park is in Uttar Pradesh, near Nepal border.
  • Famous for tiger, swamp deer (barasingha), elephant, rhinoceros.
  • Part of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve.
  • Other important Wildlife Sanctuaries/National Parks in Uttar Pradesh: Chandraprabha Wildlife Sanctuary, Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Lucknow
    • Largest District (Area): Lakhimpur Kheri
    • River: Ganga, Yamuna, Gomti
    • UP has maximum number of districts (75) in India.

question: Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is in Tamil Nadu.
  • Famous for migratory birds like painted stork, spoonbill, ibis, herons.
  • It is one of the oldest bird sanctuaries in India.
  • Other important Wildlife Sanctuaries/National Parks in Tamil Nadu: Mudumalai, Gulf of Mannar Marine National Park, Guindy National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Chennai
    • Dance: Bharatanatyam
    • River: Kaveri
    • Tamil Nadu ranks first in wind energy production in India.

question: Nokrek National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Nokrek National Park is in Meghalaya, near Tura in Garo Hills.
  • Famous for red panda, Asian elephants, hoolock gibbons, rich biodiversity.
  • It is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.
  • Other important National Parks in Meghalaya: Balpakram National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Shillong
    • Highest rainfall place: Mawsynram
    • Festival: Wangala
    • Meghalaya means “Abode of Clouds”.

question: Sariska Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Sariska Sanctuary is located in Rajasthan.
  • Famous for tigers, leopards, hyenas, and nilgai.
  • Declared as Tiger Reserve under Project Tiger (Launched in 1973).
  • Other important National Parks in Rajasthan: Ranthambore, Keoladeo Ghana (Bharatpur), Desert National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Jaipur
    • Desert: Thar Desert
    • Festival: Teej, Gangaur
    • Rajasthan has largest area among Indian states.

question: Ranthambore National Park is famous for which wildlife species?
solution:
• Ranthambore National Park is located in Rajasthan.
  • Famous for Royal Bengal Tigers, easily spotted here.
  • Declared as Tiger Reserve under Project Tiger (1973).
  • Has Ranthambore Fort (UNESCO World Heritage Site) inside park.
  • Other important National Parks in Rajasthan: Sariska, Keoladeo Ghana, Desert National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Jaipur
    • River: Banas flows nearby
    • Festival: Pushkar Fair (Asia’s largest camel and livestock fair)
    • Known as “Land of Kings”.

question: Namdapha National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Namdapha National Park is located in Arunachal Pradesh.
  • Famous for four big cats – tiger, leopard, snow leopard, clouded leopard.
  • Part of Project Tiger (1973) and a biodiversity hotspot in Eastern Himalayas.
  • Other important National Parks in Arunachal Pradesh: Mouling National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Itanagar
    • Largest tribe: Nyishi
    • River: Brahmaputra flows through state (called Siang in Arunachal)
    • Known as “Land of Dawn-Lit Mountains”.

question: Keibul Lamjao National Park is unique for being the only __________ national park in the world.
solution:
• Keibul Lamjao National Park is located in Manipur.
  • It is the only floating national park in the world, on Loktak Lake.
  • Famous for Sangai (brow-antlered deer), state animal of Manipur.
  • Other important National Parks in Manipur: None; Keibul Lamjao is the only one.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Imphal
    • Dance: Manipuri
    • Festival: Yaoshang
    • Manipur is called “Jewel of India”.

question: Simlipal National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Simlipal National Park is located in Odisha.
  • Famous for tigers, elephants, and sal forests.
  • Declared as Tiger Reserve under Project Tiger (1973) and is also a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.
  • Other important Wildlife Sanctuaries/National Parks in Odisha: Bhitarkanika National Park, Chilika Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bhubaneswar
    • Festival: Rath Yatra
    • Dance: Odissi
    • Odisha has largest brackish water lagoon (Chilika Lake) in India.

question: Ranganthittu Bird Sanctuary is located near which city in Karnataka?
solution:
• Ranganthittu Bird Sanctuary is located near Mysore, Karnataka.
  • Famous for migratory birds like painted stork, spoonbill, pelicans, kingfishers.
  • Situated on the banks of Cauvery River.
  • Other important National Parks/Sanctuaries in Karnataka: Bandipur National Park, Nagarhole National Park, Bannerghatta National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bengaluru
    • Dance: Yakshagana
    • Festival: Mysuru Dasara (Asia’s famous royal festival)
    • Karnataka is known as “Land of Sandalwood”.

question: Nagarhole National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Nagarhole National Park is located in Karnataka.
  • Famous for tiger, elephant, Indian bison (gaur), and rich forest biodiversity.
  • Part of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve and declared Tiger Reserve under Project Tiger (1973).
  • Other important National Parks in Karnataka: Bandipur, Bannerghatta, Kudremukh.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bengaluru
    • River: Kabini flows through park
    • Festival: Hampi Utsav (celebrates Vijayanagar Empire’s heritage)
    • Karnataka is the largest coffee producing state in India.

question: Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary is located in Tamil Nadu.
  • Famous for elephants, tigers, leopards, gaur, and rich bird diversity.
  • Lies at tri-junction of Karnataka, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu, forms part of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve.
  • Other important National Parks in Tamil Nadu: Guindy National Park, Gulf of Mannar Marine National Park, Mukurthi National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Chennai
    • Dance: Bharatanatyam
    • Festival: Pongal (harvest festival of Tamil Nadu)
    • Tamil Nadu has highest number of temples in India.

question: Balpakram National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Balpakram National Park is located in Meghalaya.
  • Famous for red panda, wild water buffalo, golden cat, and unique canyon landscape.
  • Known as “Land of Spirits” among Garo tribes.
  • Other important National Parks in Meghalaya: Nokrek National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Shillong
    • Highest rainfall place: Mawsynram (world’s wettest place)
    • Festival: Wangala (harvest festival of Garos)
    • Meghalaya means “Abode of Clouds.”

question: Bandipur Wildlife Sanctuary is located at the border of which two states?
solution:
• Bandipur Wildlife Sanctuary is located at the Karnataka–Tamil Nadu border.
  • Famous for tigers, elephants, gaurs, and deer.
  • Part of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve and declared Tiger Reserve under Project Tiger (1973).
  • Other important National Parks in Karnataka: Nagarhole, Bannerghatta, Kudremukh.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Karnataka Capital: Bengaluru
    • Karnataka Festival: Mysuru Dasara (Asia’s famous royal festival)
    • Tamil Nadu Capital: Chennai
    • Tamil Nadu Festival: Pongal (harvest festival)

question: Jaldapara Wildlife Sanctuary is famous for which animal?
solution:
• Jaldapara Wildlife Sanctuary is located in West Bengal.
  • Famous for One Horned Rhinoceros.
  • Located in the foothills of Eastern Himalayas, Alipurduar District.
  • Other important National Parks in West Bengal: Sundarbans National Park (famous for Royal Bengal Tiger), Buxa Tiger Reserve, Neora Valley National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Kolkata
    • Dance: Chau
    • Festival: Durga Puja (UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage)
    • West Bengal is the largest producer of rice in India.

question: Wild Ass Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Wild Ass Sanctuary is located in Little Rann of Kutch, Gujarat.
  • Famous for Indian Wild Ass (Khur).
  • Covers 4954 sq km, largest wildlife sanctuary in Gujarat.
  • Other important National Parks/Sanctuaries in Gujarat: Gir National Park (Asiatic Lion), Blackbuck National Park, Marine National Park (Gulf of Kutch).
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Gandhinagar
    • Dance: Garba
    • Festival: Navratri (largest dance festival in India)
    • Gujarat has longest coastline among Indian states.

question: Khangchendzonga National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Khangchendzonga National Park is located in Sikkim.
  • Named after Mount Khangchendzonga (3rd highest peak in the world).
  • UNESCO World Heritage Site (Mixed Category: Cultural + Natural).
  • Famous for snow leopard, red panda, Himalayan tahr.
  • Other important National Parks in Sikkim: None, this is the only National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Gangtok
    • Dance: Maruni
    • Festival: Losoong (harvest festival)
    • Sikkim is India’s first organic state.

question: Hemis National Park is located in which Union Territory?
solution:
• Hemis National Park is located in Ladakh.
  • Largest National Park in India (4400 sq km).
  • Famous for Snow Leopard, Tibetan wolf, Eurasian brown bear.
  • Located in eastern Ladakh region, north of Indus River.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Leh
    • Festival: Hemis Tsechu (monastery festival)
    • Ladakh is known as “Land of High Passes.”

question: Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary is located in Goa.
  • Situated on Chorao Island in Mandovi River.
  • Famous for mangrove forests and diverse bird species like kingfishers, egrets, cormorants.
  • Named after Dr. Salim Ali (Birdman of India).
  • Other important wildlife sanctuaries in Goa: Bhagwan Mahaveer Sanctuary, Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Panaji
    • Dance: Fugdi
    • Festival: Carnival (Portuguese legacy)
    • Goa is India’s smallest state by area.

question: Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is located in Haryana.
  • Situated in Gurugram District, famous for migratory birds like Siberian crane, flamingoes, bar-headed goose.
  • Declared as Sultanpur National Park in 1989.
  • Other important wildlife sanctuaries in Haryana: Kalesar Wildlife Sanctuary, Bhindawas Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Chandigarh
    • Dance: Phag
    • Festival: Teej
    • Haryana is known as “Land of Rotis & Wrestlers.”

question: Which national park is a part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve?
solution:
• Mudumalai National Park is part of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve.
  • Located in Tamil Nadu, shares boundaries with Karnataka and Kerala.
  • Famous for elephants, tigers, leopards, gaurs, and diverse bird species.
  • Other national parks in Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve: Bandipur (Karnataka), Nagarhole (Karnataka), Silent Valley (Kerala), Mukurthi (Tamil Nadu).
  • Extra Static GK (Tamil Nadu):
    • Capital: Chennai
    • Dance: Bharatanatyam
    • Festival: Pongal
    • Tamil Nadu has highest urban population among South Indian states.

question: Which is the only national park in India with a marine ecosystem?
option_1: Marine National Park, Gulf of Kutch
option_2: Gulf of Mannar Marine National Park
option_3: Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park
option_4: Rani Jhansi Marine National Park
solution:
• Marine National Park, Gulf of Kutch is the only national park in India with a marine ecosystem.
  • Located in Jamnagar, Gujarat.
  • Famous for coral reefs, mangroves, dolphins, turtles, and diverse marine life.
  • Other important National Parks in Gujarat: Gir National Park (Asiatic Lion), Blackbuck National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Gandhinagar
    • Dance: Garba
    • Festival: Navratri (largest dance festival in India)
    • Gujarat has longest coastline among Indian states.

question: Which national park in India is famous for saltwater crocodiles?
solution:
• Bhitarkanika National Park is located in Odisha.
  • Famous for saltwater crocodiles, mangrove forests, spotted deer, and migratory birds.
  • Second largest mangrove ecosystem in India after Sundarbans.
  • Other important National Parks in Odisha: Simlipal National Park, Nandankanan Zoological Park (White Tiger).
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bhubaneswar
    • Dance: Odissi
    • Festival: Rath Yatra (Puri)
    • Odisha is known as “Utkal” in ancient times

question: Satpura National Park is famous for what distinction?
option_1: It is the largest national park of India
option_2: It is the first reserve forest of India
option_3: It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site
option_4: It is the smallest national park of India
solution:
• Satpura National Park is located in Madhya Pradesh.
  • Famous as India’s first reserve forest, declared in 1865 (Bori Reserve Forest, part of Satpura).
  • Rich in tigers, leopards, bears, Indian giant squirrel, and diverse flora.
  • Other important National Parks in MP: Kanha, Bandhavgarh, Panna, Pench.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Bhopal
    • Dance: Rai
    • Festival: Bhagoria Haat (tribal festival)
    • MP is known as “Tiger State of India.”

question: Which is the largest bird sanctuary in Asia?
option_3: Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary
option_4: Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary
solution:
• Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary (Keoladeo Ghana National Park) is located in Rajasthan.
  • Largest bird sanctuary in Asia, famous for Siberian cranes, painted storks, and over 370 bird species.
  • UNESCO World Heritage Site.
  • Other important National Parks in Rajasthan: Ranthambhore, Sariska, Desert National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Jaipur
    • Dance: Ghoomar
    • Festival: Pushkar Mela (largest camel fair in Asia)
    • Rajasthan is largest state by area in India.

question: Guru Ghasidas Tiger Reserve is located in which state?
solution:
• Guru Ghasidas Tiger Reserve is located in Chhattisgarh.
  • Carved out from Sanjay National Park, named after Guru Ghasidas (Satnami leader).
  • Declared Tiger Reserve in 2021, shares border with Madhya Pradesh.
  • Other important National Parks in Chhattisgarh: Indravati National Park, Kanger Valley National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Raipur
    • Dance: Raut Nacha
    • Festival: Bastar Dussehra (longest festival in India, 75 days)
    • Chhattisgarh is known as “Rice Bowl of Central India.”

question: Chandra Shekhar Azad Bird Sanctuary (formerly Nawabganj) is located in which district?
solution:
• Chandra Shekhar Azad Bird Sanctuary is located in Unnao district, Uttar Pradesh.
  • Earlier known as Nawabganj Bird Sanctuary, renamed in 2015.
  • Famous for migratory birds like sarus crane, pintail, teal.
  • Other important bird sanctuaries in Uttar Pradesh: Okhla Bird Sanctuary, Sur Sarovar Bird Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK (Uttar Pradesh):
    • Capital: Lucknow
    • Dance: Kathak
    • Festival: Kumbh Mela (largest religious gathering)
    • UP is India’s most populous state.

question: The Great Himalayan National Park is located in which state?
solution:
• Great Himalayan National Park is located in Himachal Pradesh.
  • UNESCO World Heritage Site.
  • Famous for snow leopard, Himalayan brown bear, blue sheep, musk deer.
  • Other important National Parks in Himachal Pradesh: Pin Valley National Park, Inderkilla National Park, Khirganga National Park.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Shimla (summer), Dharamshala (winter)
    • Dance: Nati
    • Festival: Kullu Dussehra
    • HP is known as “Apple Bowl of India.”

question: Eravikulam National Park is famous for which animal?
solution:
• Eravikulam National Park is located in Kerala.
  • Famous for Nilgiri Tahr (state animal of Tamil Nadu).
  • Known for Neelakurinji flowers (blooms every 12 years) and Anamudi peak (highest in South India).
  • Other important National Parks in Kerala: Periyar, Silent Valley, Mathikettan Shola, Anamudi Shola.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Thiruvananthapuram
    • Dance: Kathakali
    • Festival: Onam
    • Kerala is known as “God’s Own Country.”

question: Where is Harike Bird Sanctuary located?
solution:
• Harike Bird Sanctuary is located in Punjab.
  • Situated at confluence of Beas and Sutlej rivers.
  • Famous for migratory ducks, geese, cormorants, and freshwater dolphins.
  • Other important wildlife sanctuaries in Punjab: Abohar Wildlife Sanctuary, Bir Bhadson Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Chandigarh
    • Dance: Bhangra
    • Festival: Baisakhi
    • Punjab is known as “Granary of India.”

question: Which national park is often called the “Lungs of Mumbai”?
option_1: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
solution:
• Sanjay Gandhi National Park is located in Mumbai, Maharashtra.
  • Known as “Lungs of Mumbai” due to its dense forests and clean air.
  • Famous for Kanheri Caves, leopards, deer, and diverse flora-fauna.
  • Other important National Parks in Maharashtra: Tadoba, Navegaon, Chandoli.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Mumbai
    • Dance: Lavani
    • Festival: Ganesh Chaturthi
    • Maharashtra is India’s leading state in industrial output.

question: Which river passes through Jim Corbett National Park?
solution:
• Ramganga River passes through Jim Corbett National Park, Uttarakhand.
  • The park is famous for Royal Bengal Tigers, elephants, leopards, gharials.
  • India’s first national park, established in 1936 as Hailey National Park.
  • Other important National Parks in Uttarakhand: Rajaji, Valley of Flowers, Nanda Devi.
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Dehradun
    • Dance: Chholiya
    • Festival: Kumbh Mela (Haridwar)
    • Uttarakhand is known as “Devbhoomi” (Land of Gods).

question: Which wildlife sanctuary in Assam is known for its population of wild water buffaloes?
solution:
• Manas Wildlife Sanctuary (Manas National Park) is located in Assam.
  • Famous for wild water buffaloes, golden langur, elephants, rhinos, and tigers.
  • UNESCO World Heritage Site and also a Biosphere Reserve.
  • Other important National Parks/Wildlife Sanctuaries in Assam: Kaziranga (one-horned rhino), Orang (rhino), Dibru-Saikhowa (feral horses).
  • Extra Static GK:
    • Capital: Dispur
    • Dance: Bihu
    • Festival: Bihu (celebrated thrice a year)
    • Assam is largest producer of tea in India.

question: Sandi Bird Sanctuary is located in which state?
solution:
• Sandi Bird Sanctuary is located in Hardoi district, Uttar Pradesh.
  • Also known as Dahar Jheel, famous for migratory birds like gadwall, northern shoveller, pintail.
  • Declared as a sanctuary in 1990.
  • Other important Bird Sanctuaries in UP: Nawabganj (Chandra Shekhar Azad), Sur Sarovar, Okhla.
  • Extra Static GK (Uttar Pradesh):
    • Capital: Lucknow
    • Dance: Raslila
    • Festival: Diwali
    • UP has maximum number of Lok Sabha seats (80).
